B1 a place where criminals are kept to punish them for their crimes, or where people accused of crimes are kept while waiting for their trials: the country's overcrowded jails a 13-year jail sentence/term The financier was released from jail last week. They spent ten years in jail for fraud. They don't throw anyone in jail for parking illegally, but they will tow your car and charge you a fine. Synonym
clink
More examplesFewer examplesArrangements were made to move the prisoners to another jail.He faces three years in jail for selling narcotics.He's stayed out of trouble since he was released from jail last year.There has been a mass breakout from one of Germany's top security jails.He has been languishing in jail for the past 20 years.
